intro: Saccoloma inaequale, commonly known as the unequal saccoloma, is a rare and delicate fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate fronds with a unique arrangement of pinnae. The plant exhibits a creeping rhizome system, allowing it to spread along the forest floor in shaded, moist environments. Its spores are produced in small, clustered sporangia on the undersides of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Saccoloma inaequale is considered a species of conservation concern.
